As for blue no  unanimity is requried,  the blue vote will go through.

We should vote for red as for this colour unanimity is required. If the urn colour is red, 4 teams will receive a red ball and 2 teams a blue ball. All teams must vote red to go thorugh. The problem is following: At least one of the three teams will get a blue ball. This team - normally - will take blue as the guess of the color of the urn. So the overall teams' guess is blue, even if just one blue ball appeared (and this would mean that the actual color of the urn is red). So we should take red. Trust me - if it is actually a blue urn, another blue ball must be seen by another of the three teams. And this team will choose blue as their guess. This is enough for taking blue as the overall team voting.
